tit.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 高野街道（こうやかいどう）とは、かつて京都・大阪からの高野山（和歌山県）への参詣道として用いられた街道。
sen.e: Koya-Kaido Road was in the past a pilgrimage route linking the cities of Kyoto and Osaka to Mount Koya (Wakayama Prefecture).
Koya-kaido Road can refer to a pilgrimage route that links the cities of Kyoto and Osaka with Mount Koya (Wakayama Prefecture).
sen.cmt: A sentence such as "…Road used to be..." would result in reader believing this route no longer exists, but as this doesn't seem to be the case, I have left out a direct equivalent for "かつて".kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: Koya-kaido Road can refer to a pilgrimage route that links the cities of Kyoto and Osaka with Mount Koya (Wakayama Prefecture).

sen.j: 現在の国道371号のうち、河内長野市～橋本市間の呼称にもなっている。
sen.e: Presently, the road name is used also to refer to the segment of National Route 371 between Kawachinagano City and Hashimoto City.
It can also refer to the part of National Route 371 that runs between Kawachinagano City and Hashimoto City.
It can also refer to the part of National Route 371 that runs between Kawachinagano City and Hashimoto City.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 高野街道自体は、河内国丹南郡長野村（現：河内長野市）と高野山を結ぶ街道であるが、長野以北は複数に分かれて各方面を結んだ。
sen.e: Koya-Kaido Road itself is a route linking Nagano-mura Village of Tannan-gun County, Kawachi Province (presently Kawachinagano City) with Mount Koya. However, the route north of Nagano splits into a number of roads to link various areas with Mount Koya.

The original Koya-kaido Road is a route that links Nagano-mura Village in Tannan-gun County, Kawachi Province (presently Kawachinagano City) with Mount Koya; however, the route north of Nagano splits into a number of roads that link various areas with Mount Koya.
sen.cmt: "The original Koya-Kaido Road" is a little 意訳 but clearly identifying which of the two roads is being discussed will be helpful to the reader.kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: The original Koya-kaido Road is a route that links Nagano-mura Village in Tannan-gun County, Kawachi Province (presently Kawachinagano City) with Mount Koya; however, the route north of Nagano splits into a number of roads that link various areas with Mount Koya.

sen.j: それらは西高野街道、下高野街道、中高野街道、東高野街道と呼ばれた。
sen.e: They were called Nishi Koya-Kaido Road, Shimo Koya-Kaido Road, Naka Koya-Kaido Road and Higashi Koya-Kaido Road.
These roads are Nishi Koya-kaido Road, Shimo Koya-kaido Road, Naka Koya-kaido Road and Higashi Koya-kaido Road.
sen.cmt: I know the Japanese says "呼ばれた" but I assume these roads still have the same names.kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: These roads are Nishi Koya-kaido Road, Shimo Koya-kaido Road, Naka Koya-kaido Road and Higashi Koya-kaido Road.

sen.j: 東高野街道
sen.e: Higashi Koya-Kaido Road
Higashi Koya-kaido Road
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: Higashi Koya-kaido Road

sen.j: 前身は平安京または長岡京への官道だったと推定される。
sen.e: Historically, the road is believed to have been a Kando (a road that is improved, managed, and maintained by the Japanese nation) leading to either Heian-kyo or Nagaoka-kyo (ancient capital cities).
Historically, the road is believed to have been a Kando (a road that is improved, managed, and maintained by the Japanese nation) leading to either Heian-kyo or Nagaoka-kyo (ancient capital cities).
Historically, the road is believed to have been a Kando (a road that is improved, managed, and maintained by the Japanese nation) leading to either Heian-kyo or Nagaoka-kyo (ancient capital cities).

sen.j: 京から高野山への参詣路として使用されるとともに、河内国を南北に貫く数少ない街道でもあった。
sen.e: In addition to being the road for pilgrimage to Mount Koya, it was also one of the very few routes crossing Kawachi Province in the north-south direction.
In addition to being the road for pilgrimage to Mount Koya, it was also one of the very few routes crossing Kawachi Province in the north-south direction.
In addition to being the road for pilgrimage to Mount Koya, it was also one of the very few routes crossing Kawachi Province in the north-south direction.

sen.j: 中高野街道
sen.e: Naka Koya-Kaido Road
Naka Koya-kaido Road
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: Naka Koya-kaido Road

sen.j: 起点は杭全神社西の泥堂口にあった一里塚とされる。
sen.e: The starting point of the road is believed to be the ichirizuka (milestone) located at Deidoguchi west of Kumata Shrine.
The starting point of the road is believed to be the ichirizuka (milestone) located at Deidoguchi west of Kumata Shrine.
The starting point of the road is believed to be the ichirizuka (milestone) located at Deidoguchi west of Kumata Shrine.

sen.j: 1148年に仁和寺宮覚法法親王が高野山参詣の際に通ったと考えられている。
sen.e: Monastic Imperial Prince Kakoho of Ninnaji Temple is believed to have traveled this road on his pilgrimage to Mount Koya.
Cloistered Imperial Prince Kakuho of Ninna-ji Temple is believed to have traveled this road on his pilgrimage to Mount Koya.
sen.cmt: 用語統一リストよりCloistered Imperial Prince Kakuhoに訂正しました。ハイフン補足しました。
sen.e: Cloistered Imperial Prince Kakuho of Ninna-ji Temple is believed to have traveled this road on his pilgrimage to Mount Koya.

sen.j: 西高野街道
sen.e: West Koya-Kaido Road
West Koya-kaido Road
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: West Koya-kaido Road

sen.j: 平安時代後期から鎌倉時代初期には高野参詣道として使用されていたと考えられている。
sen.e: The road is believed to have been used as the Mount Koya pilgrimage route from the late Heian Period to the early Kamakura Period.
The road is believed to have been used as the Mount Koya pilgrimage route from the late Heian period to the early Kamakura period.
The road is believed to have been used as the Mount Koya pilgrimage route from the late Heian period to the early Kamakura period.

sen.j: 室町時代から江戸時代には、商港堺と高野山との物資輸送でにぎわった。
sen.e: In Muromachi and Edo periods, it was widely used for freight transport between Mount Koya and the trade port of Sakai.
In Muromachi and Edo periods, it was widely used for freight transport between Mount Koya and the trade port of Sakai.
In Muromachi and Edo periods, it was widely used for freight transport between Mount Koya and the trade port of Sakai.

sen.j: 旧街道は現在の国道310号に沿っている。
sen.e: The old road runs alongside the present-day National Route 310.
The old road runs alongside the present-day National Route 310.
The old road runs alongside the present-day National Route 310.

sen.j: 下高野街道
sen.e: Shimo Koya-Kaido Road
Shimo Koya-kaido Road
sen.cmt: kaido 小文字にしました。
sen.e: Shimo Koya-kaido Road

sen.j: 大阪市内からの高野参りへの街道で、四天王寺を出て岩室（大阪狭山市）で西高野街道に合流した。
sen.e: The Mount Koya pilgrimage route from Osaka City, it passes by Shitennoji Temple and merges with Nishi Koya-Kaido Road at Iwamuro (in Sayama City, Osaka Prefecture).
The Mount Koya pilgrimage route from Osaka City, it passes by Shitenno-ji Temple and merges with Nishi Koya-kaido Road at Iwamuro (in Sayama City, Osaka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。kaido小文字にしました。
sen.e: The Mount Koya pilgrimage route from Osaka City, it passes by Shitenno-ji Temple and merges with Nishi Koya-kaido Road at Iwamuro (in Sayama City, Osaka Prefecture).

sen.j: 旧街道筋の大和川に下高野橋が架かっている。
sen.e: Shimo Koya-bashi Bridge is found over Yamato River along the old road.
Shimo Koya-bashi Bridge is found over Yamato River along the old road.
Shimo Koya-bashi Bridge is found over Yamato River along the old road.

sen.j: ルート
sen.e: Routes
Routes
Routes

sen.j: 起点を異にする次の4つのルートがあり、いずれも現在の河内長野市で合流。
sen.e: There are 4 routes with different starting points, as shown below. All of them merge into one road in present-day Kawachinagano City.
There are 4 routes with different starting points, as shown below, and all of them merge into one road in present-day Kawachinagano City.
sen.cmt: 分割は不要と考え、一文に訂正しました。
sen.e: There are 4 routes with different starting points, as shown below, and all of them merge into one road in present-day Kawachinagano City.

sen.j: 紀見峠を越えて橋本へ至った後、高野山へと至った。
sen.e: The routes cross over the Kimi-toge pass to Hashimoto, then reach to Mount Koya.
The routes cross over the Kimi-toge pass to Hashimoto, then reach to Mount Koya.

sen.j: 八幡（京都府八幡市）－洞ヶ峠－河内国田口村（大阪府枚方市）－郡津村（交野市）－中野村（四條畷市）－豊浦村（東大阪市）－楽音寺村（八尾市）－安堂村（柏原市）－国府村（藤井寺市）－誉田村（羽曳野市）－富田林村（富田林市）－長野村（河内長野市）西高野街道と合流
sen.e: Yawata (Yawata City, Kyoto Prefecture) - Taguchi-mura Village, Kawachi Province (Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture) - Kouzu-mura Village (Katano City) - Nakano-mura Village (Shijonawate City) - Toyoura-mura Village (Higashi-Osaka City) - Gakuonji-mura Village (Yao City) - Ando-mura Village (Kashiwabara City) - Ko-mura Village (Fujiidera City) - Konda-mura Village (Habikino City) - Tondabayashi-mura Village (Tondabayashi City) - Nagano-mura (Kawachinagano City) - Merge with Nishi Koya-Kaido Road
